statements.name: PROC CSPADE
statements.description: The PROC CSPADE statement performs sequence mining by using the cSpade algorithm.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the two-level input table.

arguments.name: PCTSUP=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum percentage level of support for a sequence.

arguments.name: SUPPORT=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum number of transactions that must occur in a sequence.

arguments.name: MINGAP=
arguments.description: specifies the minimum time difference between consecutive elements in a sequence.

arguments.name: MAXGAP=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum time difference between consecutive elements in a sequence.

arguments.name: MAXSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of items in an element in a sequence.

arguments.name: MAXLENGTH=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum number of elements in a sequence.

statements.name: CUSTOMER
statements.description: The CUSTOMER statement specifies the sequence or customer column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the sequence or customer column of the input table.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement creates a data table that contains information about frequently occurring sequences and about their support.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the created data table.

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: The TARGET statement specifies the target column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the target column of the input table.

statements.name: VISIT
statements.description: The VISIT statement specifies the event or time column of the input table.

arguments.name: variable
arguments.description: specifies the event or time column of the input table.
